intro: Spilanthes caulirhiza, commonly known as the narrowleaf Indian turnip, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance. Spilanthes caulirhiza is known for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
